message.content: This question requires reasoning based on an understanding of animal behavior and environmental factors. Option (A) is incorrect because global warming alone does not cause animals to enter cities. Option (B) is also incorrect because buildings may serve as barriers, preventing animals from entering the city. Option (C) is incorrect because warm streets alone are not a sufficient reason for animals to enter the city. Option (D) is the correct answer because logging, or the destruction of natural habitats, can force animals to seek new habitats and may lead them to enter urban areas in search of food, shelter, or resources.

Option (B), buildings, may provide shelter for some animals, but it is not the primary reason for animals entering cities. Option (C), warm streets, may attract certain animals, but it does not explain why many animals entered the city in this specific scenario.
